intro: Selinum oreoselinum, commonly known as the mountain garlic or rock garlic, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic, often finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its rhizomes and roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Selinum oreoselinum thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
